Change has been successfully merged
Please explain the test plan and the results, not just assert that you verified things.
Done
Please clean up the duplicate SOB tags.
Done
When will this happen?
dbusConnection is used in line no 377.  This condition is added to check the connection is created and valid or not. This is extra check added similarly in createSensor function.

dbusConnection gets constructed in main method and there is check in createSensors 
 to validate. IpmbSensor::read method can only be called post dbusConnection construction and I don't see any code path that will cause destruction of dbusConnection so is dbusConnection check relevant here ?
Agree. Just added to do additional dbusConnection check. I will remove.
Done

`this` capture in this lambda can cause use after free. Please rebase your patch on master HEAD. `this` capture issue is solved there. Hot replug(plug followed by unplug) is already handelled. This patch can do hot unplug.
On rebase changes in read method should not be needed. read will stop calling itself on destruction of sensor object.

Sure. 
Some synchronization issues occurs during hot unplug(elapse time between removing sensor object and unplug). To avoid this synchronization issue, I added this check. 

I will rebase and check.
Done

shouldn't read be called again?
or we stop at this point?
We just skip that read(when the sensor object is not there). others read will happen as usual.

Don't do this. This will cause this pointer also to be shared. 
If you want this pointer to be shared use weak pointer.
Ack
Done
cant we break at this point?
Ack

If break is added, then loop will not continue. But we need to erase all sensors when that particular hosts is unplugged. so, break is not needed here. 

I have added break and verified, it erases only one sensor of that host.
Ack
Can this line change be removed ? Also one line deleted. I am assuming these are not result of clang-format.
Done
Code change only for sdrSensors, please be clear in the commit message.
Done
LGTM
Should this be only for configInterfaceName(sdrInterface) and remove the test in side the handler?

This interfaceRemoved function is added for sdr sensors only as of now. Will add support for other sensors in future. 

This interfaceRemoved function is called when any of the interfaces removed in sdr sensors.

If we add interfaceRemoved function inside the sdrhandler, registering interfaceRemoved function may call multiple times as sdrhandler called multiple times and whenever it's property changed. That is the reason for keeping this interfaceRemoved handler in main function.
Gentle reminder for review
